header: ORDER BELOW EXH.1 IN CRIMINAL BAIL APPLICATION No. 13 of 2019 (Sulochana Manohar Lolar Vs. State of Maharashtra) CNR : MHST01­000149­2019

background.text: 1) This is the bail application under Sec. 439 of Code of Criminal Procedure is filed by applicant­accused in C.R.No. 591 of 2018 registered with Shahupuri Police Station.

legalActFound.stringMatched: under Sec. 439 of Code of Criminal Procedure

arguments.text: 2) Accused was arrested in above mentioned crime on 13.12.2018. The said crime is registered in respect of the offence punishable under Section 370(1)(2) of Indian Penal Code and u/Sec. 3, 4, 5, 7 of Immoral Trafficking (Prevention) Act. Accused at present is in Magisterial Custody. It is stated that, the applicant is innocent, she is arrested on suspicion, applicant is ready to furnish bail and also abide the conditions if imposed.

argumentSentences.text: 2) Accused was arrested in above mentioned crime on 13.12.2018.
The said crime is registered in respect of the offence punishable under Section 370(1)(2) of Indian Penal Code and u/Sec. 3, 4, 5, 7 of Immoral Trafficking (Prevention) Act.
Accused at present is in Magisterial Custody.
It is stated that, the applicant is innocent, she is arrested on suspicion, applicant is ready to furnish bail and also abide the conditions if imposed.

arguments.text: 3) In spite of sufficient opportunity, prosecution failed to file say.

argumentSentences.text: 3) In spite of sufficient opportunity, prosecution failed to file say.

arguments.text: 4) Heard learned Advocate for the applicant­accused. It is submitted that, applicant is poor and innocent, she is permanent resident of Satara, if she is released on bail, she will not abscond and is ever ready to assist the investigation agency.

argumentSentences.text: 4) Heard learned Advocate for the applicant­accused.
It is submitted that, applicant is poor and innocent, she is permanent resident of Satara, if she is released on bail, she will not abscond and is ever ready to assist the investigation agency.

arguments.text: 6) Considering the submissions and papers, I have to mention that, accused is in jail since 16.12.2018, despite chances, prosecution failed to file say. Considering nature of the offence, custody of accused is not required for any purpose including the purpose of investigation and accused may be granted bail. Hence, I pass following order.

argumentSentences.text: 6) Considering the submissions and papers, I have to mention that, accused is in jail since 16.12.2018, despite chances, prosecution failed to file say.
Considering nature of the offence, custody of accused is not required for any purpose including the purpose of investigation and accused may be granted bail.

order.text: O R D E R 1) Criminal Bail Application no. 13 of 2019, is allowed. 2) Applicant­accused Sulochana Manohar Lohar be released on bail on her furnishing P.R.Bond of Rs.15,000/­ (Rs. Fifteen Thousand) with surety of like amount with following conditions. a) Accused to attend Shahupuri Police Station once in a week i.e. on every Monday in between 11.00 a.m. to 1.00 p.m. till filing of charge­sheet. b) Accused shall not directly or indirectly make any inducement, threat or promise to any person acquainted with the facts of the case so as to dissuade him from disclosing such facts to the court or to any Police Officer. c) Any default of above conditions shall render the bail to be cancelled automatically. d) Compliance before lower Court.

footer: (B.S.Wavre) Place : Satara Addl. Sessions Judge Date :6th February, 2019. Satara
processedText:
ORDER BELOW EXH.1 IN CRIMINAL BAIL APPLICATION No. 13 of 2019 (Sulochana Manohar Lolar Vs. State of Maharashtra) CNR : MHST01­000149­2019 
---header-ends---
1) This is the bail application under Sec. 439 of Code of Criminal Procedure is filed by applicant­accused in C.R.No. 591 of 2018 registered with Shahupuri Police Station. 
---background-ends---
2) Accused was arrested in above mentioned crime on 13.12.2018. The said crime is registered in respect of the offence punishable under Section 370(1)(2) of Indian Penal Code and u/Sec. 3, 4, 5, 7 of Immoral Trafficking (Prevention) Act. Accused at present is in Magisterial Custody. It is stated that, the applicant is innocent, she is arrested on suspicion, applicant is ready to furnish bail and also abide the conditions if imposed. 
---argument-ends---
3) In spite of sufficient opportunity, prosecution failed to file say. 
---argument-ends---
4) Heard learned Advocate for the applicant­accused. It is submitted that, applicant is poor and innocent, she is permanent resident of Satara, if she is released on bail, she will not abscond and is ever ready to assist the investigation agency. 
---argument-ends---
6) Considering the submissions and papers, I have to mention that, accused is in jail since 16.12.2018, despite chances, prosecution failed to file say. Considering nature of the offence, custody of accused is not required for any purpose including the purpose of investigation and accused may be granted bail. Hence, I pass following order. 
---argument-ends---
O R D E R 1) Criminal Bail Application no. 13 of 2019, is allowed. 2) Applicant­accused Sulochana Manohar Lohar be released on bail on her furnishing P.R.Bond of Rs.15,000/­ (Rs. Fifteen Thousand) with surety of like amount with following conditions. a) Accused to attend Shahupuri Police Station once in a week i.e. on every Monday in between 11.00 a.m. to 1.00 p.m. till filing of charge­sheet. b) Accused shall not directly or indirectly make any inducement, threat or promise to any person acquainted with the facts of the case so as to dissuade him from disclosing such facts to the court or to any Police Officer. c) Any default of above conditions shall render the bail to be cancelled automatically. d) Compliance before lower Court. 
---order-ends---
(B.S.Wavre) Place : Satara Addl. Sessions Judge Date :6th February, 2019. Satara
